trans-unit.source: Provision Hadoop, HBase, or Storm clusters on Linux in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Provision Hadoop, HBase, or Storm clusters on Linux in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to provision Hadoop clusters on Linux for HDInsight using the management portal, the command line, and the .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to provision Hadoop clusters on Linux for HDInsight using the management portal, the command line, and the .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you'll learn about the different ways to custom-provision a Hadoop Linux cluster on Azure HDInsight - by using the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you'll learn about the different ways to custom-provision a Hadoop Linux cluster on Azure HDInsight - by using the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: Have you ever wondered why we mention clusters every time we talk about Hadoop or big data?
trans-unit.target: Have you ever wondered why we mention clusters every time we talk about Hadoop or big data?

trans-unit.source: That's because Hadoop enables distributed processing of large data, spread across different nodes of a cluster.
trans-unit.target: That's because Hadoop enables distributed processing of large data, spread across different nodes of a cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster has a master/worker architecture with a master node (also called a head node or name node) and any number of worker nodes (also called data nodes).
trans-unit.target: The cluster has a master/worker architecture with a master node (also called a head node or name node) and any number of worker nodes (also called data nodes).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Apache Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Apache Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight Cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight Cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster abstracts the Hadoop implementation details so that you don't need to worry about how to communicate with different nodes of a cluster.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster abstracts the Hadoop implementation details so that you don't need to worry about how to communicate with different nodes of a cluster.

trans-unit.source: When you provision an HDInsight cluster, you provision Azure compute resources that contain Hadoop and related applications.
trans-unit.target: When you provision an HDInsight cluster, you provision Azure compute resources that contain Hadoop and related applications.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Introduction to Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Introduction to Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The data to be churned is stored in Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: The data to be churned is stored in Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This article provides instructions on the different ways to provision a cluster.
trans-unit.target: This article provides instructions on the different ways to provision a cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you are looking at a quick-start approach to provision a cluster, see <linkText>Get Started with Azure HDInsight on Linux</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are looking at a quick-start approach to provision a cluster, see <linkText>Get Started with Azure HDInsight on Linux</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Secure Shell (SSH) keys.
trans-unit.target: Secure Shell (SSH) keys.

trans-unit.source: If you want to remote into a Linux cluster by using SSH with a key instead of a password.
trans-unit.target: If you want to remote into a Linux cluster by using SSH with a key instead of a password.

trans-unit.source: Using a key is the recommended method as it is more secure.
trans-unit.target: Using a key is the recommended method as it is more secure.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to generate SSH keys, refer to the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to generate SSH keys, refer to the following articles:

trans-unit.source: From a Linux computer - <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based HDInsight (Hadoop) from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: From a Linux computer - <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based HDInsight (Hadoop) from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: From a Windows computer - <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based HDInsight (Hadoop) from Windows</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: From a Windows computer - <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based HDInsight (Hadoop) from Windows</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: During configuration, you must specify an Azure Blob storage account and a default container.
trans-unit.target: During configuration, you must specify an Azure Blob storage account and a default container.

trans-unit.source: This is used as the default storage location by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This is used as the default storage location by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can specify additional blobs that will also be associated with your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can specify additional blobs that will also be associated with your cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using secondary blob stores, see <linkText>Using Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using secondary blob stores, see <linkText>Using Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The metastore contains information about Hive tables, partitions, schemas, columns, etc. This information is used by Hive to locate where data is stored in Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS), or Azure Blob storage for HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The metastore contains information about Hive tables, partitions, schemas, columns, etc. This information is used by Hive to locate where data is stored in Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS), or Azure Blob storage for HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: By default, Hive uses an embedded database to store this information.
trans-unit.target: By default, Hive uses an embedded database to store this information.

trans-unit.source: When provisioning an HDInsight cluster, you can specify a SQL database that will contain the metastore for Hive.
trans-unit.target: When provisioning an HDInsight cluster, you can specify a SQL database that will contain the metastore for Hive.

trans-unit.source: This allows the metadata information to be preserved when you delete a cluster, as it is stored externally in the SQL database.
trans-unit.target: This allows the metadata information to be preserved when you delete a cluster, as it is stored externally in the SQL database.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to create a SQL database in Azure, see <linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to create a SQL database in Azure, see <linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during provisioning.
trans-unit.target: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Such scripts are invoked via Script Action, which is a configuration option that can be used from the preview portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Such scripts are invoked via Script Action, which is a configuration option that can be used from the preview portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title> allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title> allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A virtual network allows you to:
trans-unit.target: A virtual network allows you to:

trans-unit.source: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).
trans-unit.target: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>diagram of cloud-only configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>diagram of cloud-only configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).
trans-unit.target: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).

trans-unit.source: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.
trans-unit.target: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>diagram of site-to-site configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>diagram of site-to-site configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>diagram of point-to-site configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>diagram of point-to-site configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more information on Virtual Network features, benefits, and capabilities, see the <linkText>Azure Virtual Network overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on Virtual Network features, benefits, and capabilities, see the <linkText>Azure Virtual Network overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You must create the Azure virtual network before provisioning a cluster.
trans-unit.target: You must create the Azure virtual network before provisioning a cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>How to create a Virtual Network</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>How to create a Virtual Network</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight only supports location-based Virtual Networks, and does not currently work with Affinity Group-based Virtual Networks.
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight only supports location-based Virtual Networks, and does not currently work with Affinity Group-based Virtual Networks.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure PowerShell cmdlet Get-AzureVNetConfig to check whether an existing Azure virtual network is location-based.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure PowerShell cmdlet Get-AzureVNetConfig to check whether an existing Azure virtual network is location-based.

trans-unit.source: If your virtual network is not location-based, you have the following options:
trans-unit.target: If your virtual network is not location-based, you have the following options:

trans-unit.source: Export the existing Virtual Network configuration and then create a new Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Export the existing Virtual Network configuration and then create a new Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: All new Virtual Networks are by default, location-based.
trans-unit.target: All new Virtual Networks are by default, location-based.

trans-unit.source: Migrate to a location-based Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Migrate to a location-based Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Migrate existing services to regional scope</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Migrate existing services to regional scope</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended to designate a single subnet for one cluster.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended to designate a single subnet for one cluster.

trans-unit.source: Currently (8/25/2015,) you can only provision one Linux-based cluster in an Azure Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Currently (8/25/2015,) you can only provision one Linux-based cluster in an Azure Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: You can provision an HDInsight Hadoop Linux cluster from a Linux computer as well as a Windows-based computer.
trans-unit.target: You can provision an HDInsight Hadoop Linux cluster from a Linux computer as well as a Windows-based computer.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides information on the provisioning options available from the different operating systems, and links to instructions for each.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides information on the provisioning options available from the different operating systems, and links to instructions for each.

trans-unit.source: Provision Linux clusters from a computer running this OS
trans-unit.target: Provision Linux clusters from a computer running this OS

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Using the .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Using the .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: Linux
trans-unit.target: Linux

trans-unit.source: Click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Not applicable
trans-unit.target: Not applicable

trans-unit.source: Not applicable
trans-unit.target: Not applicable

trans-unit.source: Windows
trans-unit.target: Windows

trans-unit.source: Click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters use an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters use an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage account located in the same datacenter is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage account located in the same datacenter is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see <linkText>How to Create a Storage Account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see <linkText>How to Create a Storage Account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Currently, only the Southeast Asia, North Europe, East US, and South Central US regions can host HDInsight Linux clusters.
trans-unit.target: Currently, only the Southeast Asia, North Europe, East US, and South Central US regions can host HDInsight Linux clusters.

trans-unit.source: To create an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: To create an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW, Click Data Analytics, and then click HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW, Click Data Analytics, and then click HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a Cluster Name, select Hadoop for the Cluster Type, and from the Cluster Operating System drop-down, select Ubuntu.
trans-unit.target: Enter a Cluster Name, select Hadoop for the Cluster Type, and from the Cluster Operating System drop-down, select Ubuntu.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear beside the cluster name if it is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear beside the cluster name if it is available.

trans-unit.source: To provision HBase or Storm clusters, select the approprite value for the Cluster Type drop-down.
trans-unit.target: To provision HBase or Storm clusters, select the approprite value for the Cluster Type drop-down.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enter cluster name and type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enter cluster name and type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one subscription, click the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one subscription, click the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click Resource Group to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.
trans-unit.target: Click Resource Group to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.

trans-unit.source: Or, you can click Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can click Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.

trans-unit.source: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.
trans-unit.target: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.

trans-unit.source: Click Credentials and then enter a password for the admin user.
trans-unit.target: Click Credentials and then enter a password for the admin user.

trans-unit.source: You must also enter an SSH Username and either a PASSWORD or PUBLIC KEY, which will be used to authenticate the SSH user.
trans-unit.target: You must also enter an SSH Username and either a PASSWORD or PUBLIC KEY, which will be used to authenticate the SSH user.

trans-unit.source: Using a public key is the recommended approach.
trans-unit.target: Using a public key is the recommended approach.

trans-unit.source: Click Select at the bottom to save the credentials configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select at the bottom to save the credentials configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provide cluster credentials</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provide cluster credentials</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see one of the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see one of the following articles:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click Data Source to choose an existing data source for the cluster, or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: Click Data Source to choose an existing data source for the cluster, or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.

trans-unit.source: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts from all your subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts from all your subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Set this to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.
trans-unit.target: Set this to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.

trans-unit.source: Select storage account / Create New: Click Select storage account to browse and select an existing storage account you want to associate with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Select storage account / Create New: Click Select storage account to browse and select an existing storage account you want to associate with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Or, click Create New to create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Or, click Create New to create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.
trans-unit.target: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.

trans-unit.source: Location: The geographic region that the storage account is in, or will be created in.
trans-unit.target: Location: The geographic region that the storage account is in, or will be created in.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.
trans-unit.target: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.

trans-unit.source: Click Select to save the data source configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select to save the data source configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: Set the number of worker nodes that you need for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Set the number of worker nodes that you need for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown within the blade.
trans-unit.target: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown within the blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Select to save the node pricing configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select to save the node pricing configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click Optional Configuration to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a Virtual Network, setting up an External Metastore to hold data for Hive and Oozie, use Script Actions to customize a cluster to install custom components, or use additional storage accounts with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Optional Configuration to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a Virtual Network, setting up an External Metastore to hold data for Hive and Oozie, use Script Actions to customize a cluster to install custom components, or use additional storage accounts with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click the HDInsight Version drop-down and select the version you want to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click the HDInsight Version drop-down and select the version you want to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>HDInsight cluster versions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>HDInsight cluster versions</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Virtual Network: Select an Azure virtual network and the subnet if you want to place the cluster into a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Virtual Network: Select an Azure virtual network and the subnet if you want to place the cluster into a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Virtual network blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Virtual network blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Windows based HDInsight cluster can only be placed into a classical virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Windows based HDInsight cluster can only be placed into a classical virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Click External Metastores to specify SQL database that you want to use to save Hive and Oozie metadata associated with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click External Metastores to specify SQL database that you want to use to save Hive and Oozie metadata associated with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Custom metastores blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Custom metastores blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Use an existing SQL DB for Hive metadata, click Yes, select a SQL database, and then provide the username/password for the database.
trans-unit.target: For Use an existing SQL DB for Hive metadata, click Yes, select a SQL database, and then provide the username/password for the database.

trans-unit.source: Repeat these steps if you want to Use an existing SQL DB for Oozie metadata.
trans-unit.target: Repeat these steps if you want to Use an existing SQL DB for Oozie metadata.

trans-unit.source: Click Select till you are back on the Optional Configuration blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Select till you are back on the Optional Configuration blade.

trans-unit.source: The Azure SQL database used for the metastore must allow connectivity to other Azure services, including Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SQL database used for the metastore must allow connectivity to other Azure services, including Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure SQL database dashboard, on the right side, click the server name.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure SQL database dashboard, on the right side, click the server name.

trans-unit.source: This is the server on which the SQL database instance is running.
trans-unit.target: This is the server on which the SQL database instance is running.

trans-unit.source: Once you are on the server view, click Configure, and then for Azure Services, click Yes, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Once you are on the server view, click Configure, and then for Azure Services, click Yes, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Script Actions if you want to use a custom script to customize a cluster, as the cluster is being created.
trans-unit.target: Script Actions if you want to use a custom script to customize a cluster, as the cluster is being created.

trans-unit.source: For more information about script actions, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about script actions, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: On the Script Actions blade provide the details as shown in the screen capture.
trans-unit.target: On the Script Actions blade provide the details as shown in the screen capture.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Script action blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Script action blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Azure Storage Keys to specify additional storage accounts to associate with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Azure Storage Keys to specify additional storage accounts to associate with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Storage Keys blade, click Add a storage key, and then select an existing storage account or create a new account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Storage Keys blade, click Add a storage key, and then select an existing storage account or create a new account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Additional storage blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Additional storage blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Select till you are back on the New HDInsight cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Select till you are back on the New HDInsight cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: On the New HDInsight Cluster blade, ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then click Create.
trans-unit.target: On the New HDInsight Cluster blade, ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then click Create.

trans-unit.source: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.
trans-unit.target: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.

trans-unit.source: | While provisioning | Provisioning complete | | ------------------ | --------------------- | | <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText> | <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText> |
trans-unit.target: | While provisioning | Provisioning complete | | ------------------ | --------------------- | | <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText> | <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText> |

trans-unit.source: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: Once the provisioning completes, click the tile for the cluster from the Startboard to launch the cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: Once the provisioning completes, click the tile for the cluster from the Startboard to launch the cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: The cluster blade provides essential information about the cluser such as the name, the resource group it belongs to, the location, the operating system, URL for the cluster dashboard, etc.
trans-unit.target: The cluster blade provides essential information about the cluser such as the name, the resource group it belongs to, the location, the operating system, URL for the cluster dashboard, etc.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the icons at the top of this blade, and in the Essentials section:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the icons at the top of this blade, and in the Essentials section:

trans-unit.source: Settings and All Settings: Displays the Settings blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Settings and All Settings: Displays the Settings blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Dashboard, Cluster Dashboard, and URL: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is a Web portal to run jobs on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Dashboard, Cluster Dashboard, and URL: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is a Web portal to run jobs on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Secure Shell: Information needed to access the cluster using SSH.
trans-unit.target: Secure Shell: Information needed to access the cluster using SSH.

trans-unit.source: Delete: Deletes the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Delete: Deletes the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Quickstart (cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart): Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Quickstart (cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart): Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Users (users icon): Allows you to set permissions for portal management of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Users (users icon): Allows you to set permissions for portal management of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: This only affects access and permissions to this cluster in the Azure preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This only affects access and permissions to this cluster in the Azure preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Tags (tag icon): Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.
trans-unit.target: Tags (tag icon): Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may create a key named project, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may create a key named project, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions on how to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions on how to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For information on configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information on configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see <linkText>Administer HDInsight using PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see <linkText>Administer HDInsight using PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For the list of the HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see <linkText>HDInsight cmdlet reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the list of the HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see <linkText>HDInsight cmdlet reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell:
trans-unit.target: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell:

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure resource group
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure resource group

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Blob container
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Blob container

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: The two most important parameters that you must set to provision Linux clusters are the ones where you specify the OS type and the SSH user details:
trans-unit.target: The two most important parameters that you must set to provision Linux clusters are the ones where you specify the OS type and the SSH user details:

trans-unit.source: Make sure you specify the -OSType parameter as Linux.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you specify the -OSType parameter as Linux.

trans-unit.source: To use SSH for remote sessions on the clusters, you can specify either SSH user password or the SSH public key.
trans-unit.target: To use SSH for remote sessions on the clusters, you can specify either SSH user password or the SSH public key.

trans-unit.source: If you specify both the SSH user password and the SSH public key, the key will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: If you specify both the SSH user password and the SSH public key, the key will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the SSH key for remote sessions, you must specify a blank SSH password when prompted for one.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the SSH key for remote sessions, you must specify a blank SSH password when prompted for one.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see one of the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see one of the following articles:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The values you specify for $clusterCredentials are used to create the Hadoop user account for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The values you specify for $clusterCredentials are used to create the Hadoop user account for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You will use this account to connect to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You will use this account to connect to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The values you specify for the $sshCredentials are used to create the SSH user for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The values you specify for the $sshCredentials are used to create the SSH user for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You use this account to start a remote SSH session on the cluster and run jobs.
trans-unit.target: You use this account to start a remote SSH session on the cluster and run jobs.

trans-unit.source: If you use the Quick Create option from the Azure portal to provision a cluster, the default Hadoop user name is "admin" and default SSH user name is "hdiuser".
trans-unit.target: If you use the Quick Create option from the Azure portal to provision a cluster, the default Hadoop user name is "admin" and default SSH user name is "hdiuser".

trans-unit.source: It can take several minutes before the cluster provisioning finishes.
trans-unit.target: It can take several minutes before the cluster provisioning finishes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.CLI.Provision</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.CLI.Provision</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that make it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET Framework application.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that make it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET Framework application.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions below to create a Visual Studio console application and paste the code for creating a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions below to create a Visual Studio console application and paste the code for creating a cluster.

trans-unit.source: To create a Visual Studio console application
trans-unit.target: To create a Visual Studio console application

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, click New, and then click Project.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, click New, and then click Project.

trans-unit.source: From New Project, type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: From New Project, type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Category
trans-unit.target: Category

trans-unit.source: Templates/Visual C#/Windows
trans-unit.target: Templates/Visual C#/Windows

trans-unit.source: Template
trans-unit.target: Template

trans-unit.source: Console Application
trans-unit.target: Console Application

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: CreateHDICluster
trans-unit.target: CreateHDICluster

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to create the project.

trans-unit.source: From the Tools menu, click Nuget Package Manager, and then click Manage Nuget Packages for Solutions.
trans-unit.target: From the Tools menu, click Nuget Package Manager, and then click Manage Nuget Packages for Solutions.

trans-unit.source: In the Search text box within the dialog box, search for HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: In the Search text box within the dialog box, search for HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: From the results that show up, install the following:
trans-unit.target: From the results that show up, install the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight.Job
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Azure.Management.HDInsight.Job

trans-unit.source: Search for Azure Authentication and from the results that show up, install Microsoft.Azure.Common.Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Search for Azure Authentication and from the results that show up, install Microsoft.Azure.Common.Authentication.

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, double-click Program.cs to open it, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables:
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, double-click Program.cs to open it, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables:

trans-unit.source: Press F5 to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press F5 to run the application.

trans-unit.source: A console window should open and display the status of the application.
trans-unit.target: A console window should open and display the status of the application.

trans-unit.source: You will also be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.
trans-unit.target: You will also be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.

trans-unit.source: It can take several minutes to create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: It can take several minutes to create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you have learned several ways to provision an HDInsight Hadoop cluster on Linux.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned several ways to provision an HDInsight Hadoop cluster on Linux.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see the following articles:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Working with HDInsight on Linux</linkText><title></title>: Get to know the nuances of working with an HDInsight cluster on Linux.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Working with HDInsight on Linux</linkText><title></title>: Get to know the nuances of working with an HDInsight cluster on Linux.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari</linkText><title></title>: Learn how to monitor and manage your Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster by using Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari</linkText><title></title>: Learn how to monitor and manage your Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster by using Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use MapReduce with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn about the different ways to run MapReduce jobs on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use MapReduce with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn about the different ways to run MapReduce jobs on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use Hive with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn about the different ways of running a Hive query on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use Hive with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn about the different ways of running a Hive query on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use Pig with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn about the different ways of running a Pig job on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use Pig with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn about the different ways of running a Pig job on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn how HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage to store data for HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn how HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage to store data for HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Upload data to HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn how to work with data stored in an Azure Blob storage for an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Upload data to HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn how to work with data stored in an Azure Blob storage for an HDInsight cluster.
